docs.abstract: (Matt Ross) Alexander Olch is a film director and the owner and designer of Alexander Olch New York. He is currently finishing production on "The Windmill Movie" and his spring 2008 collection of men's neckties, bow ties and accessories arrives in stores this week. Olch graduated from the all-boys Collegiate School in New York City, [...]

docs.snippet: One well-informed blogger picks "Juno" to reign this year....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even in the homestretch -- Oscar ballots are due today -- some people are having trouble generating enthusiasm about this year's race. Scott Feinberg is not one of them. As the overlord of the And the Winner Is blog he has covered every wiggle and wobble in the race, some real and some imagined, and spends a great deal of time reporting, which is breathtakingly uncommon in the blog world.
docs.abstract: One well-informed blogger picks "Juno" to reign this year.

headline.main: 'Juno' How to Stir Up the Homestretch?

docs.snippet: Will everone just get back in the car and drive home after this year's party-poor Oscars?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Surely something will rush in to fill the post-Oscar vacuum created by the cancellation of this year's Vanity Fair party? Surely not, says Anne Thompson. She suggests all of the action will be on the run-up, after which the air will just start leaking out of the balloon. She also says that the Elton John bash, which is billed as a viewing party, will stay that way.
docs.abstract: Will everone just get back in the car and drive home after this year's party-poor Oscars?

docs.snippet: We ninnies love the Oscars. But why? Please help the Bagger understand his addiction to all things O....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger was asked to explain his fascination with the Oscars the other day and he felt as if he had been outed as a fan of show tunes or heirloom Fiesta table settings. The really embarrassing thing is that he not only enjoys the Oscars, he cares about them -- more, probably, than he should.
docs.abstract: We ninnies love the Oscars. But why? Please help the Bagger understand his addiction to all things O.

docs.snippet: Awards Central points out that if you release a picture late in the year and it picks up some gold dust, it can put you in the money pretty quickly. Click here for a nice chart and good analytics on the Oscar effect, with data from Box Office Mojo...

docs.snippet: The Golden Guy's dirty little secret....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Gold Rush takes a peek under the gold plate and finds out that Oscar puts his pants on one leg at a time, although he really only has one leg, when you think about it.
